data.title: Always a great time at Griffin's Pub & Grill
data.text: A friendly neighborhood pub with good food right in downtown Utica. Mike and Debbie are great hosts always making everyone feel welcome. Whether a 1st timer or a regular, you'll enjoy the atmosphere of what a neighborhood pub should be. Try the reuben burger...one of the best sandwiches in the area.

data.title: Great people
data.text: Great people, really good food, always good portions. atmosphere and staff are top notch. Very laid back.

data.title: Great Atmosphere
data.text: The atmosphere is nice and quaint.  The staff and company is great, very sociable.  There are TV's, jukebox, food is available.  Nice bar where you can enjoy your company, listen to music, shoot darts, play pool etc....

data.title: Classic Bar
data.text: A buddy and I were on our way back to Syracuse from Albany, dying to find a comfortable bar for a couple of beers and some chicken wings.  We found Griffins Pub while driving on the main drag in Utica.  We were there around 3 pm, place was quiet with only 3 customers, we sat at the far end of the bar.  Bartenders were friendly and attentive.  We ordered a couple of drafts, chili cheese fries, a reuben and turkey club.  Food came out pretty quickly and was very good.  Wings weren't on the menu but we had a good time and relaxed.

data.title: A welcome here for you
data.text: We wandered in here one evening after a tiring day sightseeing and driving received a great welcome. We spent the evening perched on bar stools chatting to mine host and some local people. Next day we checked out of our hotel and headed back to Griffin's. I had a bacon burger and my partner the Italian sausage both freshly cooked and delicious. So it was good food at reasonable prices

data.title: Nice friendly spot for a beer and pub food
data.text: This was the closest place to the Radisson we were staying at and it's definitely worth visiting.    Super nice woman chatted us up and shared local stories over a beer while whipping us up a snack of a Ruben and Grilled Cheese.  Tasty and hit the spot.   It's not super fancy, but it's very friendly and a good spot to have a bite and beer.

data.title: Super service
data.text: We visited after the Irish festival. When we arrived, we were met by Michael, the owner. We asked if they had food, he said they were usually not open on a Sunday but were only open for an after party. He offered to turn the grill and fryer back on if we did not mind waiting 10 minutes. A few minutes later we had fresh hot burgers and fries. The food was very good. Our server Eddie was very friendly and attentive. The crowd and Eddie started singing along to the music. It was such a fun and friendly atmosphere, everything anyone could want in a neighborhood pub.

data.title: super friendly staff
data.text: Griffin's pub has the nicest staff.  Drinks are a good price and now that they offer food, it is an even better happy hour location in downtown Utica.

data.title: Amazing service from Deb and Mike!
data.text: I came to Griffins to have some drinks and ask for a long shot favor. I needed to be measured for my wedding suit.... Deb turned out to be an amazing tailor and gave me complete measurements!! Never have i had such a ridiculously awesome time at a bar... not to mention Deb kept me in line with my future wife. Thanks Deb and Mike!

data.title: a more comfortable version of Cheers
data.text: great atmosphere, conveniently located -- small outside seating area available -- friendly management and patrons.  Didn't get a chance to eat but received positive recommendations and encouragement.  Very attractive afternoon bartender.

data.title: Genuinely friendly service
data.text: Writing this not so much for the food but because the people serving us were so nice. We both liked out our burger and hot dog, but the conversation was what made it such a welcome break from our long road trip. Check out the museum and town if you have time: both are lovely. Major impressionist exhibit 2 blocks from the restaurant!

data.title: Best Burger in town
data.text: service e is wonderful. Homemade soups and the absolute best burger. Owners are on site and couldn't be more friendly and helpful. Love this place

data.title: Beer
data.text: All good. Nice little bar. Wish it was open on Mondays. Fairly clean, cold draft. Not really an older crowd.

data.title: Nice Irish Pub
data.text:
(Business) Lunches were good! Typical pub style menu!  The Raquel was my favorite. Very friendly staff. Open kitchen.
Nice Irish Pub after hours.

data.title: Nice place for a drink.
data.text: This is one of the places we used to go to when we were younger.  It's still a nice place, some things don't change.

data.title: Back again
data.text: Tried the turkey special great value with truly an awesome taste ...well done Deb great job as always ...only thing missig was my favorite server Maddy boo

data.title: Great Place!
data.text: Stopped in here on my way out of town for lunch. What a terrific place. Not pretentious. Great atmosphere.... And the food was terrific! The service was great. I will go there for dinner next time I am in town.

data.title: Best of the Best
data.text: Stopped in Utica on business for a night and was hankering for a burger and and a beer... What a great burger it was.... The Reuben Burger is to die for, hand pressed, fresh brisket, all local handmade ingredients, Mike and Debbie are the most pleasant people I've ever met for a downtown business, what made it even more unique was being served up by the lovely Madison, such a sweetheart. Must try. Get the word out folks!!! Don't pass up the chance to stop at Griffin's Pub, you won't be disappointed!!!!!

data.title: Gets better each time I visit
data.text: Great hot dog special even better than patio drive in.. drinks are cold and unique.  Outside dining is a special touch

data.title: Back again and even better
data.text: Visited again this weekend-- the food, the music and the pool table was the best... Thanks to thwe owners Mike and Debbie
